alert.note: Alert for Fairfield; New Haven (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 10 at 12:46AM EST until further notice by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 AM EST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southern Connecticut, including the following counties, Fairfield, Middlesex and New Haven. * WHEN...Until 230 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1246 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... New Haven, Waterbury, Danbury, Meriden, Middletown, Wallingford, Shelton, Naugatuck, Guilford, Southbury, New Canaan, Wolcott, Durham, Newtown, Fairfield, Hamden, Trumbull, Cheshire, Westport and North Haven. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
